intro: Quivisia mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius quivisia, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has smooth, often hairy stems and produces small, elliptical leaves. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas or disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
